questions.question: Which factor differentiates lost foam casting from investment casting? (LO3)

answers.a: Use of foam instead of wax for the pattern
answers.c: Higher cost compared to investment casting

explanations.a: Investment casting uses wax patterns, whereas lost foam casting uses polystyrene foam, which vaporises upon metal pouring.

questions.question: Why does lost foam casting not require a parting line? (LO1)

answers.a: Because the foam pattern is made in two halves
answers.b: Because the pattern vaporises completely during casting
answers.c: Because the sand mould is permanently bonded

explanations.a: In lost foam casting, the foam pattern is fully consumed by the molten metal, eliminating the need for a split mould or a parting line, which are typically required in traditional casting processes.

questions.question: What role does the refractory coating play in lost foam casting? (LO1)

answers.b: It acts as a mould release agent
answers.c: It prevents metal penetration into the sand
answers.d: It speeds up the vaporisation of the foam

questions.question: What is one disadvantage of using unbonded sand in lost foam casting? (LO2)

answers.a: It requires additional binders to hold its shape
answers.c: It may shift if not properly compacted

explanations.a: Since unbonded sand is loose, it relies on vibration for compaction. If not properly compacted, the sand can shift during pouring, affecting the accuracy and surface quality of the casting.
